name: ATV Quad Frenzy
description:
ATV Quad Frenzy is a 3D ATV off-road racing game. It focuses largely on the handling of the vehicles and the way they reacts to the bumps of the track. This means paying attention to the suspension and it also means big air, where you can perform tricks by selecting a trick with the select button, then holding the A and B buttons.

There are a variety of ATVs and five modes to choose from. The modes are practice, quick race, championship race circuit, championship pro circuit and a multiplayer head-to-head mode.

The game includes a virtual garage in which players can upgrade their ATVs through a touch-screen interface. Tires, suspension, etc can be replaced.

shot.caption: If you were expecting a countdown, you'd be in for a rude awakening. The race begins even before the screen is done fading in.
At it's best, the game looks almost impressive.
The vehicle physics are as crude as they get.
Each combination of vehicle and a rider is composed of 500 polygons... I say they didn't do a very good job with those.
Even when a rider gets knocked off his bike his animation remains relative to the vehicle as the two of them are one unit.

The directional arrow on the bottom screen is completely useless, as it points the way from the perspective of your position on the top-down map... where the direction of your heading is not indicated
If you watch the bottom screen closely, you will see that the racer's dots can significantly deviate from the set course driving all over parts of the screen not meant for the map.
The courses lack any collision boundaries, so you can leave it, and just keep on going over infinitely generated voxel terrain.
Colliding with anything in this game, be it a flat cutout of a rock or another rider will send your vehicle spinning out of control.
The game features "Stunts", which neither count toward anything, nor can be failed. Performing them requires you to select a stunt with SELECT, and execute it with A+B in mid-air...
Racing on one of the lake tracks.
Lakes maps are possibly the most robust in the game, they also have the most performance issues.
